parameters: \n<Galathan><Wrap>(I should make sure everyone is alright...)
\nr<Esther><Wrap>Be careful, Lily. This is a cursed place.
\n<Liliana><Wrap>You do not believe in that, do you?
\nr<Esther><Wrap>The Gods condemned this place. There is poison in the ground. Just look at how sickly even the trees look.
\n<Liliana><Wrap>Looks more like a natural blight to me. You ever see a tree with wormrot? Looks a lot like this.
\nr<Esther><Wrap>Whoever is buried here greatly angered the Gods. Just... please be careful.
\n<Liliana><Wrap>That's why the King sent you with me!
\nr<Esther><Wrap>Yeah... Alright, let's go in and take a look around.
\nr<Esther><Wrap>NOOOO! NO NO NO NO NO!!! NO!
\nr<???><Wrap>Don’t try to speak. You’re dying. Actually, you already died if you want to get specific about it... but never mind that. I will put you back together again.
\n<???><Wrap>A difference in opinion on the matters of what constitutes life and death. A good thing, too, for your sake, otherwise I wouldn’t have stumbled upon you.
\n<???><Wrap>Your body is going to get far worse before I can make it better.
\n<???><Wrap>Who? There was nobody else with you.
\nr<Esther><Wrap>Singing. She is singing our song... Down by the river...
\n<???><Wrap>Most peculiar. Auditory hallucinations. I will have to look into that.
\nr<Esther><Wrap>No. I can hear her. She’s here!

\n<Baenor><Wrap>He's lost a lot of blood, Captain. It's best that we don't move him for now...
\n<Baenor><Wrap>Nate is as as good as he's gonna be, for now. If we are to move, we should do it now.
\n<Nathan><Wrap>I'll be alright, Cap. Did Thomas catch up yet?
\n<Nathan><Wrap>Ah, I see... Probably just celebrating his victory.
\n<Galathan><Wrap>Yeah... And when this is over, we will celebrate with him.
\n<Galathan><Wrap>But right now, we need to get moving.
\n<Alyssa><Wrap>I think Nate was wounded more than we knew.
\n<Alyssa><Wrap>Baenor did the best he could, Nate isn't gonna get any better than this.
\nr<Galathan><Wrap>I’ve heard the stories, but never have met the man that he was before.
\n<Alex><Wrap>You are a lot like him. I mean, the old him, when he was the Captain of the Guard.
\n<Alex><Wrap>He is what he is because of what I asked him to do...
\n<Alex><Wrap>Sharon was very sick. The Wrack, the physician said.
\n<Alex><Wrap>I remember how she looked. Her skin was so blemished and faded. Her cheeks so hollow, eyes dark and sunken… I could feel the bones in her fingers.
\n<Alex><Wrap>She was dying, Sir, and I would do anything to keep her with me.
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>She has a couple more days, but beyond that it is in the hands of the Gods.
\nr<Alex><Wrap>Is there nothing that can be done for her? Anything?
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>I’m afraid not, Majesty. The Wrack is a most dangerous and vicious disease.
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>I’m reluctant to even mention this... but...
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>Well, a colleague of mine from the Lyceum did tell me of a type of Kingsroot that supposedly could treat this malady.

\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>But I know of no case where it has been used due to how incredibly difficult it is to acquire. I couldn’t say if it would even work if we had it. How my colleague came about this information, I do not know.
\nr<Alex><Wrap>But… there is hope that it could work?
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>I shouldn’t have mentioned it, your Majesty. I fear it only gives false hope.
\nr<Alex><Wrap>What makes it so hard to come by?
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>From what I was told, it grows only within the Tomb of the Unknown King.
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>Nobody with their proper faculties would visit such a cursed place. Kingsroot is supposedly very easy to confuse for the poisonous Pale Thistle.
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>It would take a skilled Apothecary to properly identify it, if it exists at all.
\nr<Royal Physician><Wrap>My apologies, Majesty. I shouldn’t have mentioned it.
\nr<Alex><Wrap>If there is even the slightest chance that this is true…
\nr<Alex><Wrap>Captain Esther, would you join us a moment?
\nr<Esther><Wrap>How might I be of service, Majesty?
\nr<Alex><Wrap>If my memory is correct, your wife… Lilianna is it? She is a Lyceum-trained Apothecary is she not?
\nr<Esther><Wrap>She is, your Majesty. Do you require her services?
\nr<Alex><Wrap>I have need of both yours and her services.
\n<Alex><Wrap>You should check on Sir Nathan. Master Baenor should be about finished by now.
\n<Alex><Wrap>You should check on Sir Nathan. Master Baenor should be about finished by now.
\n<Merchant><Wrap>Looks like you lot found some trouble. What can I interest you in?
\n<Skill Trainer> <Wrap>All damage-dealing and healing skills will be increased, and it will cost \c[14]750 Sovereigns\c[0]. Do you wish to continue?
\n<Skill Trainer> <Wrap>All damage-dealing and healing skills will be increased, and it will cost \c[14]750 Sovereigns\c[0]. Do you wish to continue?
\n<Skill Trainer> <Wrap>Hmm... You don't have enough Soveriegns for the training. Come back again later!
\n<Skill Trainer> <Wrap>I've already taught you all that I can for this Class.

\n<Villager><Wrap>It's very rare such commotion finds its way to our small village. I hope there's no trouble following you to here.
